channel.title: Doing Indy - The Indianapolis Podcast
channel.itunes:subtitle: Cool, fun, hip and exciting things to do in Indianapolis
channel.itunes:author: visitindy.com
channel.description: Indianapolis is a rare breed. A city that combines the best in sports, culture, dining and entertainment all in a convenient package. It's a perfect travel destination for singles and families alike, with something new always on the horizon.
channel.itunes:summary: Indianapolis is a rare breed. A city that combines the best in sports, culture, dining and entertainment all in a convenient package. It's a perfect travel destination for singles and families alike, with something new always on the horizon.

item.title: 2012 Indianapolis Super Bowl Village Nightlife
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: Doing Indy hits the Super Bowl Village as the sun goes down and the lights come up. Evan and Zach sample the "Shrimp Cocktail To Go" at St. Elmo's, experience the Play 60 Kinect Fan Dome and rock the night away with free live music.
item.itunes:summary: Doing Indy hits the Super Bowl Village as the sun goes down and the lights come up. Evan and Zach sample the "Shrimp Cocktail To Go" at St. Elmo's, experience the Play 60 Kinect Fan Dome and rock the night away with free live music.

item.title: 2012 Super Bowl Media Day At Lucas Oil Stadium
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: Doing Indy went out to Media Day at Lucas Oil Stadium to hear what players and other media personalities had to say about Indianapolis. We chatted with Tom Brady, Eli Manning, Victor Cruz, Adam Schefter and Chris Mortensen fromESPN, Brett Keisel from the Steelers and LA Sports Personality Vic âThe Brickâ Jacobs to hear what they had to say during Super Bowl XLVI. The Big Game is now just a few days away and everyone in Indianapolis is excited!

item.title: NFL Experience at the 2012 Super Bowl in Indianapolis
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: At the heart of the 2012 Super Bowl in Indianapolis, you can take part in the NFL Experience. This interactive football theme park is a must-do for all football fans during Super Bowl XLVI. Take a look at everything happening inside the Indiana Convention Center!

item.title: Zipline Ride Over Downtown Indianapolis
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: Watch what it's like to Soar over downtown Indianapolis and Super Bowl Village on a Zip line. Whether you have Super Bowl tickets or not, you can visit Indy before the big game and take part in all the action!

item.title: Indianapolis Street Food Showdown at the Indy City Market
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: See what was going on at the Super Street Food Showdown at the Indianapolis City Market in downtown Indianapolis. From morning until afternoon there was plenty going on at the City market- there were more than 10 of Indianapolis' best food trucks, including Duos, West Coast Tacos, The NY Slice, Scratch Truck, Mabel on the Move, Scout's Treats and more. In addition to all of the food trucks outside of City Market, there were also 6 local chefs competing in a street food/comfort food competition inside. Check out some great footage of great food, chefs, people and an all around great day in downtown Indianapolis. Get ready for the Super Bowl in February!
item.itunes:summary: See what was going on at the Super Street Food Showdown at the Indianapolis City Market in downtown Indianapolis. From morning until afternoon there was plenty going on at the City market- there were more than 10 of Indianapolis' best food trucks, including Duos, West Coast Tacos, The NY Slice, Scratch Truck, Mabel on the Move, Scout's Treats and more. In addition to all of the food trucks outside of City Market, there were also 6 local chefs competing in a street food/comfort food competition inside. Check out some great footage of great food, chefs, people and an all around great day in downtown Indianapolis. Get ready for the Super Bowl in February!
item.itunes:keywords: Super Bowl Super Bowl 2012 Indianapolis Street Food Food Trucks Indianapolis City market Downtown Indianapolis

item.title: Haircuts & Razor Shaves at Red's Classic Barber Shop in Indianapolis
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: If you are ever visiting Indianapolis and looking for a great haircut or a classic razor shave, check out Red's Classic Barber Shop in downtown Indianapolis. Red's is a classic barber shop located in the heart of Indy and is within walking distance to just about everything downtown. In addition to classic haircuts, razor shaves and shampoos, Red's also has some pretty cool items for sale as well. We saw some cool bowties, vintage cufflinks, shave lotions, old fashioned razors, hats and a ton more. If you ever get a chance to visit while you're in Indianapolis or you're just looking a little too scruffy, go and check out Red's downtown.
item.itunes:summary: If you are ever visiting Indianapolis and looking for a great haircut or a classic razor shave, check out Red's Classic Barber Shop in downtown Indianapolis. Red's is a classic barber shop located in the heart of Indy and is within walking distance to just about everything downtown. If you ever get a chance to visit while you're in Indianapolis or you're just looking a little too scruffy, go and check out Red's downtown.
item.itunes:keywords: Red's Red's Barber Shop Barber Shop Indianapolis Downtown Indianapolis Indy

item.title: Soldiers & Sailors Monument at Monument Circle in Downtown Indianapolis
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: Located in the heart of downtown Indianapolis on Monument Circle, the Soldiers & Sailors Monument could be the most iconic image of Indianapolis. To honor all of the US veterans, Zach & Evan decided to take the trek all the way to the top of the monument... on foot. Check out their climb up to one of the highest points downtown and check out the view from the observation deck at the top, which is open to the public.
item.itunes:summary: Located in the heart of downtown Indianapolis on Monument Circle, the Soldiers & Sailors Monument could be the most iconic image of Indianapolis. To honor all of the US veterans, Zach & Evan decided to take the trek all the way to the top of the monument... on foot. Check out their climb up to one of the highest points downtown and check out the view from the observation deck at the top, which is open to the public.
item.itunes:keywords: Monument Circle Downtown Indianapolis Indianapolis Soldiers & Sailors Monument

item.title: Holidays in Indianapolis
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description:
What is there to do in Indianapolis during the holidays? How do you find out? You ask Santa.
With so much to do in Indianapolis during the holidays we stopped by the Indiana State Museum to talk with the man himself, Santa, to find out the best ways to celebrate this holiday season. We stopped by the Eiteljorg Museum to check out Jingle Rails, the Circle of Lights, Yuletide at the Indianapolis Symphony Orchestra, the Indianapolis Zoo and more. With so many holiday events, activities, entertainment, exhibits and attractions in Indy, it's hard to fit them in to one video. Watch to find out a few of the holiday traditions in Indy and go to http://visitindy.com/indianapolis-events-holidays-festivals to find out many more ways to celebrate when you visit Indy this year.

item.title: The Indianapolis Museum of Art
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description:
The Indianapolis Museum of Art, also known as the IMA, is one of the nation's largest and oldest general art museums.
Located on 152 acres of gardens and grounds, the museum's permanent collection spans a vast range of cultures and eras, and includes 100 Acres - one of the United States' foremost contemporary sculpture parks.
item.itunes:summary:
The Indianapolis Museum of Art, also known as the IMA, is one of the nation's largest and oldest general art museums.
Located on 152 acres of gardens and grounds, the museum's permanent collection spans a vast range of cultures and eras, and includes 100 Acres - one of the United States' foremost contemporary sculpture parks.

item.title: The Indianapolis
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: Every four years global attention is paid to Indianapolis for the International Violin Competition, better known as "The Indianapolis." Participants from around the world train their entire lives to compete in Indianapolis for prizes and the honor of being called Champion.

item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: Rhythm is alive and well in downtown Indianapolis and you can discover your own at the Rhythm! Discovery Center. Full of interactive exhibits, visitors to the Center are able to experience Rhythm while learning a little music history along the way.

item.title: Victory Field
item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: Nestled in downtown Indianapolis you will find Victory Field, voted the "Best Minor League Ballpark in America" and home to the Indianapolis Indians, Triple-A affiliate of the Pittsburgh Pirates. This ballpark has a wonderful combination of friendly atmosphere, fun and excitement for the entire family.
item.itunes:summary: Nestled in downtown Indianapolis you will find Victory Field, voted the "Best Minor League Ballpark in America" and home to the Indianapolis Indians, Triple-A affiliate of the Pittsburgh Pirates. item.itunes:author: visitindy.com
item.description: Kick back, relax and enjoy a great cigar. Add a fantastic martini to the mix and you are looking at a great night in Indianapolis. With a variety of Cigar & Martini Bars in and around the city, itâs easy to find the perfect place to fit your needs. Downtown Indy has three, distinct, venues all within walking distance of each other. Chill out at Oliveâs, get your groove on at Subterra Lounge or enjoy the swank style of Nicky Blaineâs, anyway you go, you canât go wrong.
